page.title: 12 RELIGION
page.content: { Churches}in Ellesmere Port vary considerably. Originally there were only the{village churches}associated with their small communities and these still exist today. Collectively they form the Borough of Ellesmere Port and Neston. Most the churches belong to the{Church of England.}The next generation of churches belong to the era when the town was being built into the industrial complex we have today. These churches located close to the town centre, served the new inhabitants earlier this century who came to take advantage of the new employment.More recently in the 1950's and 1960's smaller churches, of other denominations, were built including {Roman Catholic and Methodist.}These were intended to provide places of worship for the people who moved into the new housing of this era.
